overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research and announcements related to computational social science, disinformation, and coordinated online behavior. LinkedIn provides the largest audience, but engagement varies across platforms.

contentThemes.description: Sharing updates on research projects, publications, and grant awards.
Discussions and insights related to computational methods for social media analysis.
Focus on detecting and studying disinformation campaigns and coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Posts related to hiring and research opportunities.

recommendations: Tailor content to each platform's audience. Share more professional updates on LinkedIn and research-focused content on Mastodon and Bluesky.
Increase engagement by asking more questions and encouraging discussion in posts.
Use relevant hashtags consistently across platforms to expand reach.
Share visual content (images, videos) to enhance engagement.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky has a good balance of research announcements and opportunities. Focus on fostering discussions and community engagement.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon is used for sharing research updates and participating in academic discussions. Increase engagement by posing questions and joining conversations.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is highly effective for professional announcements and reaching a wider audience. Maintain a professional tone and focus on career-related updates and opportunities.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.

Now hiring: Two postdoctoral researchers to join our team working on computational methods for social media analysis. Background in data science, computational social science, or related fields preferred.
